item.title: 与 Uber Eats 和 DoorDash 达成具有里程碑意义的协议，澳大利亚外卖送餐员将获得最低工资
item.description: 在 Uber Eats 和 DoorDash 与该国运输工会达成协议后，澳大利亚送餐员有望获得最低工资水平，这被誉为世界首创。【原文：Australian food delivery workers are on course to gain minimum pay levels after Uber Eats and DoorDash struck a deal with the country's transport union that is being hailed as a world first.】

item.title: 报废费推高车价，俄罗斯汽车市场 2026 年前景黯淡
item.description: 经销商和专家表示，随着 2025 年即将结束，俄罗斯低迷的汽车市场已显示出微弱的复苏迹象，但随着报废费用的提高推动价格上涨，明年年初的汽车市场将创下近乎历史新低。【原文：Russia's depressed car market has shown weak signs of recovery as 2025 draws to an end, but is set to hit near-record lows early next year as higher scrappage fees drive up prices, dealers and experts say.】

item.title: 波兰反垄断监督机构就隐私政策调查苹果公司
item.description: 波兰反垄断局 UOKiK 周二表示，该局正在调查苹果公司是否通过其隐私政策限制了移动广告市场的竞争。【原文：Poland's anti-monopoly office UOKiK is investigating whether Apple is restricting competition in the mobile advertising market through its privacy policy, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 英国多米诺比萨首席执行官下台，战略转型初见成效
item.description: 英国多米诺比萨集团周二表示，其首席执行官安德鲁-雷尼（Andrew Rennie）已经卸任，将由首席运营官尼古拉-弗兰普顿（Nicola Frampton）临时接替。【原文：Britain's Domino's Pizza Group said on Tuesday that its CEO Andrew Rennie had stepped down, and would be replaced by Chief Operations Officer Nicola Frampton, on an interim basis.】

item.title: 英国易捷航空年度利润超预期，假期业务目标上调
item.description: 英国航空公司易捷航空周二公布的全年营业利润好于预期，并在提前完成之前的目标后，上调了假期业务的中期目标。【原文：British carrier easyJet reported better-than-expected full-year operating profit on Tuesday and upgraded its medium-term target for its holidays business after meeting the previous goal early.】

item.title: 台湾称 "不了解 "就美国芯片关税问题与韩国合作的情况
item.description: 台湾总理赵政泰周二表示，他 "没有任何信息 "显示台湾与韩国就美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收半导体关税一事进行了任何合作，并补充说台湾只与美国进行谈判。【原文：Taiwan Premier Cho Jung-tai said on Tuesday he had "no information" about any cooperation with South Korea on U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs on semiconductors, adding that Taiwan was conducting talks only with the United States.】

item.title: 报道称韩国执政党将根据关税协议提出美国投资法案
item.description: 据金融新闻社 Money Today 周二报道，韩国执政党民主党将于本周提出一项法案，根据一项削减韩国出口关税的协议，促进韩国在美国的投资。【原文：South Korea's ruling Democratic Party will propose a bill this week that would facilitate the country's investment in the U.S. under a deal that cuts tariffs on the country's exports, financial news service Money Today reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 新加坡命令苹果和谷歌防止在信息平台上欺骗政府
item.description: 新加坡内政部周二表示，新加坡警方已下令苹果公司AAPL.O和谷歌公司GOOGL.O防止在其信息平台上欺骗政府机构。【原文：Singapore's police have ordered Apple AAPL.O and Google GOOGL.O to prevent the spoofing of government agencies on their messaging platforms, the home affairs ministry said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞标在鸽派的翅膀上盲目飞行
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: ACEA 称 10 月份欧洲汽车销量增长 4.9
item.description: 欧洲汽车制造商协会周二的数据显示，由于电动汽车的注册量超过了汽油车和柴油车，10月份欧洲新车销量增长了4.9%。【原文：New car sales in Europe rose 4.9% in October as electric cars outpaced petrol and diesel registrations, European Automobile Manufacturers' Association data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道：尼日利亚丹格特公司选择霍尼韦尔帮助实现雄心勃勃的产能扩张
item.description: 尼日利亚丹格特公司（Dangote）选择霍尼韦尔（Honeywell）提供服务，帮助其在 2028 年前将炼油能力提高一倍，达到每天 140 万桶，这最清楚地表明其成为世界上最大炼油厂的计划正在取得成果。【原文：Nigeria's Dangote has tapped Honeywell to provide services and help double its refining capacity to 1.4 million barrels per day by 2028, in what is the clearest indication yet that its plans to become the world's largest petroleum refinery are bearing fruit.】

item.title: 美国降息希望升温，亚洲股市走高
item.description: 由于美联储将在 12 月降息的希望越来越大，亚洲股市周二反弹，而投资者也纷纷涌入全球科技股，摆脱了对该行业过热的担忧。【原文：Asian share markets rallied on Tuesday as hopes grew the Federal Reserve will deliver a December interest rate cut, while investors piled into global technology stocks shrugging off concerns the sector was becoming overheated.】

item.title: 供应过剩问题与乌克兰谈判争夺投资者关注焦点，石油价格趋稳
item.description: 由于结束乌克兰战争的谈判仍无结果，人们对明年石油供应将超过需求的担忧超过了对俄罗斯石油仍将受到制裁的担忧，因此周二油价变化不大。【原文：Oil prices were little changed on Tuesday after rising in the previous session as concerns supply will exceed demand next year outweighed worries Russian shipments will remain under sanctions as talks to end the Ukraine war remain inconclusive.】

item.title: 即使美联储减息再次出现，美元仍不为所动
item.description: 美元周二持稳，因为在政策制定者发表鸽派言论后，投资者正在考虑美联储下月降息的可能性，而脆弱的日元仍处于干预观察期。【原文：The U.S. dollar was steady on Tuesday as investors deliberated the chances of the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates next month after dovish comments from policymakers while the frail yen remained on intervention watch.】

item.title: 谷歌与 Accel 合作支持印度人工智能初创企业
item.description: Alphabet 旗下谷歌和风险投资公司 Accel 的高层管理人员周四表示，两家公司将合作资助至少 10 家处于早期阶段的印度人工智能初创企业，这是美国科技巨头首次开展此类资助合作。【原文：Alphabet's Google and venture capital firm Accel will partner to fund at least 10 early-stage Indian AI startups, marking the U.S. technology giant's first such funding partnership, top executives at the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，亚马逊力推内部人工智能编码工具 Kiro 而非竞争对手的工具
item.description: 根据路透社查阅的一份内部备忘录，亚马逊建议其工程师放弃第三方公司的人工智能代码生成工具，转而使用自己的工具，此举是为了加强其在 7 月份发布的专有 Kiro 服务。【原文：Amazon suggested its engineers eschew AI code generation tools from third-party companies in favor of its own, a move to bolster its proprietary Kiro service, which it released in July, according to an internal memo viewed by Reuters.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，Spotify 将于明年第一季度提高美国价格
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周一援引三位知情人士的话报道称，Spotify 将在明年第一季度提高其在美国的订阅价格。【原文：Spotify will raise its U.S. subscription prices in the first quarter of next year, the Financial Times reported on Monday, citing three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 澳大利亚林纳斯公司（Lynas）警告称，电力中断后卡尔古利的产量将出现短缺
item.description: 澳大利亚林纳斯稀土公司（Lynas Rare Earths）周二表示，由于电力供应严重中断，该公司估计其位于西澳大利亚州卡尔古利（Kalgoorlie）的工厂本季度可能出现相当于一个月产量的短缺。【原文：Australia's Lynas Rare Earths said on Tuesday it estimates a potential shortfall equivalent to one month's production during the current quarter at its Kalgoorlie facility in Western Australia following significant power supply disruptions.】

item.title: Realpage 同意限制数据收集，就司法部租金价格垄断案达成和解
item.description: 周一的法庭文件显示，美国司法部已与 RealPage 达成和解，RealPage 被指控通过软件共享定价信息，帮助房东固定房租。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department has reached a settlement with RealPage over allegations it helped landlords fix rents by sharing pricing information through its software, court papers showed on Monday.】

item.title: 交易日 美联储 12 月减息再起波澜
item.description: 了解推动全球市场的各种力量【原文：Making sense of the forces driving global markets】

item.title: 因人工智能数据中心需求强劲，Keysight 季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 周一，电子设备制造商 Keysight Technologies 预测第一季度收入和利润将超过华尔街预期，使其股价在盘后交易中上涨超过 13%。【原文：Electronic equipment maker Keysight Technologies forecast first-quarter revenue and profit ahead of Wall Street estimates on Monday, sending its shares up more than 13% in after-market trading.】

item.title: 特朗普旨在推动人工智能创新，建立利用政府数据的平台
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统周一签署了一项行政命令，在整个政府范围内启动一项努力，建立一个综合人工智能平台，利用联邦科学数据集来训练下一代技术。【原文：President Donald Trump on Monday signed an executive order to launch a government-wide effort to build an integrated artificial intelligence platform to harness federal scientific datasets to train next-generation technologies.】

item.title: 混合工作对人工智能工具的需求加速，Zoom Communications 上调年度展望
item.description: 受益于混合工作趋势和人工智能与产品的融合，Zoom Communications 周一上调了年度收入和利润预期。【原文：Zoom Communications raised its annual revenue and profit forecast on Monday, benefiting from hybrid work trends and the integration of artificial intelligence into its products.】

item.title: 哈马斯袭击受害者起诉 Bin，指控其允许向激进组织付款
item.description: 2023 年 10 月哈马斯袭击以色列事件的受害者起诉 Binance 及其创始人赵长鹏，指控他们为向该组织和其他美国指定的恐怖组织支付数百万美元提供便利。【原文：Victims of Hamas' October 2023 attack on Israel sued Binance and its founder Changpeng Zhao, accusing them of facilitating millions of dollars in payments to the group and other U.S.-designated terrorist groups.】

item.title: 亚马逊将在印第安纳州投资 150 亿美元加强数据中心基础设施建设
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）计划在北印第安纳州投资约 150 亿美元建设数据中心园区，这家科技巨头表示，它希望提高云计算能力，以支持蓬勃发展的人工智能需求。【原文：Amazon.com is planning to invest about $15 billion in Northern Indiana to build data center campuses, the tech giant said as it looks to boost its cloud computing capacity to support booming artificial intelligence demand.】

item.title: 苹果销售团队裁员
item.description: 苹果公司周一表示，它将裁减销售团队的工作岗位，以加强与客户的接触，并指出只有少数岗位会受到裁员的影响。【原文：Apple said on Monday it is cutting jobs across its sales teams to strengthen its customer engagement efforts, noting that only a small number of roles will be impacted by the layoffs.】

item.title: 三艘船驶往美国墨西哥湾沿岸码头，为中国装载大豆和高粱
item.description: 根据路透社看到的船期表，周一有两艘货轮驶往新奥尔良附近的谷物港口码头，装载自五月以来第一批运往中国的美国大豆。【原文：Two cargo vessels were headed for grain port terminals near New Orleans on Monday to load with the first U.S. soybean shipments to China since May, according to a shipping schedule seen by Reuters.】

item.title: ELFA 称，10 月份美国企业设备借贷增长超过 5
item.description: 美国设备租赁与融资协会周一表示，10月份美国公司的设备采购融资借贷比去年同期增加了5.7%，这表明近期政府停摆的影响不大。【原文：U.S. companies borrowed 5.7% more to finance equipment purchases in October than a year earlier, showing little impact from the recent government shutdown, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局将调查未遵守停飞规定的航空公司
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周一表示，该局将向40个主要机场未按要求削减航班的航空公司发出调查函，这些机场是在政府停摆期间因空中交通管制安全问题而被迫削减的。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration will send investigative letters to airlines that did not comply with required flight cuts at 40 major airports prompted by air traffic control safety concerns during the government shutdown, the agency said on Monday.】

item.title: 辛克莱提出收购 E.W. 斯克里普斯，以扩大广播电视覆盖范围
item.description: 美国广播公司辛克莱（Sinclair）提出以现金加股票的方式收购 E.W. 斯克里普斯公司（E.W. Scripps），该交易对其较小竞争对手的估值为 5.38 亿美元。【原文：U.S. broadcaster Sinclair has offered to buy E.W. Scripps in a cash-and-stock deal that values its smaller rival at $538 million, as cord-cutting and competition from streaming services lead to consolidation in the media industry.】
